DatasetContact.PostalAddress: National Biodiversity Data Centre, WIT West Campus, Waterford

DatasetInformation.MethodsOfDataCapture: Data are casual records sent in by the public to the National Biodiversity Data Centre.
DatasetInformation.PurposeOfDataCapture: To better understand the geographical distribution and ecology of Irish butterflies and to help with their conservation
DatasetInformation.DataQuality: All data validated by Dr Liam Lysaght

SurveyInformation.SurveyTitle: Butterflies of Tramore and environs - Tony Bryant
SurveyInformation.DataSubject: A dataset of butterfly sightings from Tramore Co. Waterford and environs made by Tony Bryant
SurveyInformation.MethodsOfDataCapture: Casual field observations and a minority of records from moth light traps
SurveyInformation.PurposeOfDataCapture: To record the distribution of butterflies in and around Tramore Co. Waterford
SurveyInformation.DataQuality: The determination and validation of records was by Tony Bryant, an expert lepidopterist

SurveyInformation.DataSubject: A dataset of butterfly sightings made by Ken Bond
SurveyInformation.MethodsOfDataCapture: Mixture of casual field observations and traps
SurveyInformation.PurposeOfDataCapture: To record the distribution of butterflies
SurveyInformation.DataQuality: The determination and validation of records was by Ken Bond, an expert lepidopterist

SurveyInformation.SurveyTitle: Casual Observations by Chris and Lynda Huxley
SurveyInformation.DataSubject: Records made by by Chris and Lynda Huxley on a casual basis
Records made by Mark Telfer on visits to Ireland.

SurveyInformation.SurveyTitle: Butterflies of County Waterford - Michael O'Meara
SurveyInformation.DataSubject: A dataset of butterfly sightings for the county of Waterford made by Michael O'Meara
SurveyInformation.PurposeOfDataCapture: To record the distribution of butterflies in the county.
SurveyInformation.DataQuality: The determination and validation of the records was by Michael O'Meara, a naturalist with deep knowledge of wildlife in the county of Waterford
SurveyInformation.AdditionalInformationSource: Waterford Wildlife website http://www.waterfordwildlife.com/ , established and managed by Michael O'Meara

SurveyInformation.SurveyTitle: Waterford butterflies 2006-2009. Paul M Walsh and Declan McGrath
SurveyInformation.DataSubject: Over 2,300 records of butterflies collected in Co Waterford during from 2006 to 2009 mainly during fieldwork for the Waterford Breeding Bird Atlas project
SurveyInformation.MethodsOfDataCapture: Field observations, mainly at 2km (tetrad), 1km or finer scale
SurveyInformation.PurposeOfDataCapture: Assisting with local and national mapping of butterflies
SurveyInformation.DataQuality: Preliminary checks of data quality completed (rare or unlikely species queried), systematic validation of locations against grid references still needed
SurveyInformation.AdditionalInformationSource: Preliminary dataset derived from all butterfly records collected during April-July of the years 2006 to 2009 by the dataset providers plus other volunteers on the Waterford Bird Atlas project, and incidental records from other months where available; to be updated in due course with 2010 and 2011 data
